journals.notes: This is a useless ticket since the client can play the server demos just fine. The process starts a local server that actually plays back the demo for the client, but this is the same process as you playing a map with bots locally.

You're right, appropriate commands are also available within the client but I couldn't get them to work. I tried to test two demos but neither worked.

Here are my demo files:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/19256625/nq1.sv_84 (map: supply, mod: nq 1.2.9)
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/19256625/silent1.sv_84 (map: adlernest_2, mod: silent 0.9.0)

When I start the first one (sv_demo nq1) I'm just being connected to an empty local server. However, when I start the second one, my ET:L client crashes to the desktop. I'm on Win 10.
So suprisingly some one has broken it, as it did work, but it always was just my testing stuff.
Changing the ticket as its original request was invalid.

details.name: subject
details.old_value: Let clients play server recorded demos
details.new_value: Add menu(s) for controlling sv demos playback

details.name: description
details.old_value:
Would be nice to have a possibility to play server recorded demos on the client.

Currently, only server can play such demos (file format is .sv_84)
details.new_value: Add appropriate interface for sv demos playback in client menus (like Replays for dm_84).

subject: Add menu(s) for controlling sv demos playback
description: Add appropriate interface for sv demos playback in client menus (like Replays for dm_84).
